intro: Justicia sivadasanii, commonly known as the Sivadasanii flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
